string-array.name: result_meaning
string-array.item: Your measurement indicates a very high tension index and an excellent recovery ability. Although you are very tense, your ability to recover is great. This means that you have sufficient resources to cope with current and future challenges and to recover from them quickly.
Your measurement indicates a very high tension index and a good recovery ability. Despite the very high tension, you still have enough reserves to cope with challenges and also to recover from them.

Your measurement indicates a very high tension index and a satisfactory recovery ability. Despite the very high tension, you still have some reserves left to cope with challenges and also to recover from them. As soon as you can, try to take some time out to relax in order to restore your reserves fully and get ready for the next challenge.

Your measurement indicates a very high tension index and a poor recovery ability. This means that your resources are depleted and your body is overwhelmed with the current challenges. It is important for your health that you take some time out to recharge your batteries.

Your measurement indicates a high tension index and an excellent recovery ability. Although you are tense, your ability to recover is great. This means that you have sufficient resources to cope with current and future challenges and recover from them quickly.
Your measurement indicates a high tension index and a good recovery ability. Although you are tense, you have sufficient resources to successfully recover from current and future challenges.

Your measurement indicates a high tension index and a satisfactory recovery ability. Despite the high tension, you still have some reserves left to cope with challenges and also to recover from them. As soon as you can, try to take some time out to relax in order to restore your reserves fully and get ready for the next challenge.

Your measurement indicates a high tension index and a poor recovery ability. This means that your resources are exhausted and your body is overwhelmed with the current challenges. It is important for your health that you take some time out to recharge your batteries.

Your measurement indicates a medium tension index and an excellent recovery ability. This healthy tension and great recovery ability show that you have sufficient resources to cope with current and future challenges and to recover from them quickly.

Your measurement indicates a medium tension index and a good recovery ability. This healthy tension and the adequate recovery ability show that you have sufficient resources to cope with current and future challenges and to recover from them quickly.

Your measurement indicates a medium tension index and a satisfactory recovery ability. Your health is not negatively affected by the current tension. However, your body might soon run out of energy reserves to cope with increased stress. Take some time out to relax in order to restore your full reserves and get ready for the next challenge.

Your measurement indicates a medium tension index and a poor recovery ability. The low recovery ability shows that your resources are exhausted and your body is overwhelmed with the current challenges. It is important for your health that you take some time out to recharge your batteries.

Your measurement indicates a low tension index and an excellent recovery ability. The low tension and great recovery ability show that you have more than enough resources to cope with current and future challenges and to recover from them quickly.

Your measurement indicates a low tension index and a good recovery ability. The low tension and the adequate recovery ability show that you have enough resources to cope with current and future challenges and to recover from them quickly.

Your measurement indicates a low tension index and a satisfactory recovery ability. You are not tense. However, your body might soon run out of energy reserves to cope with increased stress. Take some time out to relax in order to restore your reserves fully and get ready for the next challenge.

Your measurement indicates a low tension index and a poor recovery ability. Even though you are not tense, your body does not have sufficient energy reserves to cope with increased stress. Take some time out to relax in order to restore your reserves fully and get ready for the next challenge.

resources.string: We recommend measuring your tension index daily to check your progress and get accurate results.
To provide you with more precise information of your state, please rate whether the interpretation you see reflects your current state:
It reflects to a small extent
Great, now that we have the Baseline Measurement we can start the Biofeedback Exercise. On the next screen you will see some instructions about the exercise.
Before starting the breathing exercise, we will take a quick measurement of your baseline HRV (Heart Rate Variability)
Please sit still and hold the finger on the camera, slightly beside the flash, not on the flash
Cover the back camera fully with your finger, without applying too much pressure
Check your HRV before the Breathing Exercise
please sit straight, in a comfortable position
breathe in when the circle gets bigger
breathe out when the circle gets smaller
make sure that your finger stays on the phone back camera
remember to breathe into your belly and not your chest
inhale through your nose and exhale through your mouth

Biofeedback is a mind-body technique enabling you to learn about your physiological responses and how to change them to improve your health, well-being, and performance. By monitoring your vital signs, you can gain control over physiological processes that are usually considered unconscious or automatic.
Breathing out through pursed lips will reduce the effort that exhalation takes and gives you more control over your breathing pace.

With our biofeedback exercise, we will help you to enhance the connection between your heart and brain. HRV-Biofeedback has been shown to have beneficial effects on several health issues ranging from chronic pain to anxiety and depression.
To have a good understanding of how to breathe right, try the following exercise without the smartphone:
Sit in an upright position, relax your shoulders, shifting them downward away from the ears.
Put the left hand on your chest and the right hand on your stomach.

Without straining or pushing, breathe in through your nose and feel the air moving through your nostrils. Exhale slowly through pursed lips (as if you were whistling). With your right hand feel your belly getting bigger during the inhalation phase, and smaller during the exhalation phase.The left hand on the chest should not move.
The position you adopt for sitting (upright, with relaxed shoulders) will help you to relax some of your upper body muscles and better regulate your respiration performance

Placing your hands on your chest and abdomen will enhance your perception of how your body changes during abdominal breathing and will help you reproduce these changes in the long term. Abdominal breathing is the most efficient way to breathe, maximizing the expansion ability of the lungs.
Breathing in through your nose will filter, humidify and warm up the inhaled air. Some research indicates that this type of breathing activates brain centers responsible for sensory experiences.
You haven’t recorded any biofeedback exercise yet.
All progress takes place outside the comfort zone.
Your HR Range has improved by:
You now have better regulation over your emotions and increased resilience to stress.
See how your heart is follows your breathing
Unfortunately, it seems like this module of your Android phone does not support our measurement
We are sorry for the inconvenience. \nWe are working on it!
It seems like something went wrong
Try to gently place your finger on the camera, keeping it 2-3 mm away from the flash
Try to use another finger to get a better result
Try to apply less pressure on the camera
Try to sit comfortably without moving
Sit still and try not to move or speak.
Gently place your finger on the camera, keeping it 2-3 mm away from the flash.
If the signal is poor, try to move your finger closer to the flash. Also, try to increase or decrease the pressure applied on the camera to improve signal quality.
If your finger gets too hot, please end the measurement and start again once the camera cooled down.
Do not apply too much pressure on the camera.
When the inner circle appears completely red, the signal is strongest and you will see your pulse wave appear on the screen.
The signal that we measure is displayed as waves. You can distinguish a good signal from a \"noisy\" one as shown below. A real pulse contains clear peaks and valleys as repetitive elements.
After the measurement, we will ask you some questions to enable a more detailed interpretation of your results.
For your phone this is the best camera to use
Please select a value from the list
Try to gently place your finger on the camera, keeping it 2-3 mm away from the flash
Try to use another finger to get a better result
Try to sit comfortably without moving
Try to apply less pressure on the camera
It seems like something went wrong
Your battery is too low to perform a measurement
The flash of your phone is currently unavailable due to low battery. Unfortunately, without the flash we cannot accurately measure your pulse. Please charge your phone and try again later.
You are repeating your measurement too soon. Your results might differ from previous tests.

Heart rate variability (HRV) is a highly sensitive marker of your body’s stress response and is affected by several factors: the activity performed before the measurement, the time of day, your body position or breathing pace, and more.
HRV readings repeated in a short time range are more likely to reflect small changes in measurement conditions rather than the body’s well-being.
We suggest tracking HRV at selected, meaningful moments throughout the day, week, and/or month; for example, before, during and after work, physical exercise or relaxation activities.
Did you have any of this less than one hour before the measurement:
Put your finger on the camera
This overview shows how your mood has changed over time.
This overview shows how your pulse has changed over time.
This index reflects the energy reserves you had at the time of a measurement. The higher the value, the faster you were able to recover from stress.
This result is a measure of the tension in your cardiovascular system. Low values indicate a state of relaxation, whereas high values indicate a state of stress.
Gently place your finger on the camera, keeping it 2–3 mm away from the flash
Put your finger on the heart rate sensor
Please answer the questions that follow in order to get a detail-based result
Sit comfortably and do not move
When the inner circle appears completely colored, the signal is strongest and you’ll see your pulse wave appear on the screen
In order to get better results, please keep your finger as still as possible during the measurement.
Are you satisfied with your physical condition?
Yes, I am in a good condition
Have you ever been diagnosed with any of the diseases or health disorders listed here?
What is your highest level of education?
Please describe your current job status. You are:
To get an individualized evaluation of your results, please answer a few questions first.

How do you estimate your average physical activity during a week (brisk walking, jogging, cycling, swimming, playing sports or any exercise that increases breathing and heart rate continuously for at least 20 minutes)?
Low - once per week or less
High - 4-5 times per week or more
If you skip the questionnaire, we unfortunately cannot offer you a precise interpretation of your results. \n\nDo you still wish to skip this question?
Do you have family history of cardiovascular diseases? (i.e. father or brother who had a heart attack by age 55, or mother or sister who had a heart attack by age 65)
Does an illness or injury currently hinder you at work?
I can do my work, but I have discomfort due to a health issue
Due to a health issue, I am sometimes forced to work slower
Due to a health issue, I am often forced to work slower
Due to a health issue, I am only able to work part-time
I am not able to work
Are you currently taking medication on a regular basis?
How many cigarettes do you usually smoke?
How often do you consume alcoholic beverages?
What is the usual amount of alcohol you consume per drinking situation?
Your answers now allow us to evaluate your results with higher precision.\nReady for your first personalized measurement?
The value that you have entered seems unlikely. Please enter a value between %s - %s.
What did you do right before the measurement?
Did you have any caffeine 1 hour before the measurement?
Have you taken part in any intensive physical activity in the past 24 hours?
Was your activity before the measurement a positive or negative experience?
Have you eaten in the past two hours?
Tap back button again to abort the measurement
How are you feeling right now?
Did you have any nicotine 1 hour before the measurement?
Would you like to write a note for today?
Could you give a detailed description?
How did you sleep last night?
Did you consume any of the following substances before the measurement?
You are able to recover very well.
You are able to recover well.
You are able to partially recover.
The baseline measurement should be done before you get up from bed (before standing up) and before any drink/cigarette consumption.
What affects the result and how can it be improved?

Currently, you are in a bad mood. Your mood can have a big impact on your emotional but also on your physical state. Try to become more aware of the effect your mood has on your body to have more control over your responses to daily challenges.

Currently, you are in a good mood. Your mood can have a big impact on your emotional but also on your physical state. Try to become more aware of the effect your mood has on your body to have more control over your responses to daily challenges.

Currently, you are in an excellent mood. Your mood can have a big impact on your emotional but also on your physical state. Try to become more aware of the effect your mood has on your body to have more control over your responses to daily challenges.

Currently, you are feeling okay. Your mood can have a big impact on your emotional but also on your physical state. Try to become more aware of the effect your mood has on your body to have more control over your responses to daily challenges.

• Activity: When you exercise, your pulse naturally rises. While resting, sitting or standing, your heart rate usually does not change. However, it may increase slightly during the first 15 seconds of standing and then settle back down.

 • Emotions: If you feel stressed, anxious, or euphoric, your pulse may increase. Whereas, if you feel tired, the pulse decreases.

 • Medications: Medications that inhibit your adrenaline, called beta blockers, usually slow down your pulse, whereas, some thyroid medications may increase it.

 • Body size: Obesity can cause an increase in the resting pulse (usually no more than 100 beats per minute).

 •Temperature: When the air temperature and humidity are high, your heart pumps more blood, which can cause a slight increase in pulse rate (between 5 and 10 beats per minute).
You currently have excellent energy reserves and are well prepared to recover from present and future challenges. You can easily relax and recharge your batteries.

You currently have enough energy reserves and are well prepared to recover from present and future challenges. Nevertheless, make sure that you do not overstrain your body and occasionally allow yourself some time off.

Your body is slowly running out of energy reserves. Therefore, it will be difficult for you to recover from present and future stress and strains. Take some time and allow yourself a break to rebuild your reserves.

At the moment, you have hardly any energy reserves left. Therefore, it will be extremely difficult for you to recover from present and future challenges. It is crucial that you take time to recharge your batteries.

You have a high tension index, which is a hallmark of cardiovascular system stress. We are all exposed to a variety of stress factors on a daily basis. But our individual response to stress can be crucial for our health. Try to observe how you are feeling and acknowledge what is stressing you. Take a minute to reflect and process this information, so that you can pay better attention to your body and your needs in the future.

You have a low tension index. This indicates that your cardiovascular system works efficiently, with few resources being invested in current activities. However, this may still lead to an overly relaxed state that makes you feel lethargic. Our bodies need a certain amount of tension in order to be alert and function at their best. Try to stand up and move a little, take deep breaths or simply do a few quick stretches to activate your body.

You have a medium tension index, which indicates that your body is in a balanced state. It is alert and full of energy. This state is optimal because a slight healthy tension helps us to be attentive and agile and makes the body function at its best.

You have a very high tension index, which is a hallmark of high cardiovascular system stress. Possible causes are physical strain, pressure to perform, interpersonal problems or other stressful situations, unhealthy habits, or pharmacological treatment. It is crucial that you take time to consider the factors that are affecting your current state. This will help you to prevent stress in the future and improve the quality of your life in the long run.

Your pulse is relatively high. If you have taken medication, exercised or felt very stressed right before the measurement, these may be the reasons for your elevated pulse. Otherwise, a high pulse indicates that at the moment, your cardiovascular system is not working efficiently. Sometimes, it can reflect a prolonged or chronic stress state. You may want to discuss the causes of your elevated heart rate with your doctor.

Your heart rate is relatively low. As long as you have not taken any medication before the measurement and are not tired, this indicates that your cardiovascular system is working very efficiently. Relatively few heartbeats are needed to supply blood to your organs.
Your heart rate looks normal. It takes an average number of heartbeats to supply your organs with blood.

This index reflects your available energy reserves. Your body needs these reserves to recover from challenges and to quickly adjust to subtle changes in the environment. The higher the value, the faster you will be able to recover from stress.
This result is a measure of the tension in your cardiovascular system. The lower the value, the more relaxed you are. The higher the value, the more tense you are.
Your measurement indicates a high tension index and a good recovery ability. Although you are tense, you have sufficient resources to successfully recover from current and future challenges.

Your measurement indicates a high tension index and a poor recovery ability. This means that your resources are exhausted and your body is overwhelmed with the current challenges. It is important for your health that you take some time out to recharge your batteries.

Your measurement indicates a high tension index and a satisfactory recovery ability. Despite the high tension, you still have some reserves left to cope with challenges and also to recover from them. As soon as you can, try to take some time out to relax in order to restore your reserves fully and get ready for the next challenge.

Your measurement indicates a high tension index and an excellent recovery ability. Although you are tense, your ability to recover is great. This means that you have sufficient resources to cope with current and future challenges and recover from them quickly.

Your measurement indicates a low tension index and a good recovery ability. The low tension and the adequate recovery ability show that you have enough resources to cope with current and future challenges and to recover from them quickly.

Your measurement indicates a low tension index and a poor recovery ability. Even though you are not tense, your body does not have sufficient energy reserves to cope with increased stress. Take some time out to relax in order to restore your reserves fully and get ready for the next challenge.

Your measurement indicates a low tension index and a satisfactory recovery ability. You are not tense. However, your body might soon run out of energy reserves to cope with increased stress. Take some time out to relax in order to restore your reserves fully and get ready for the next challenge.

Your measurement indicates a low tension index and an excellent recovery ability. The low tension and great recovery ability show that you have more than enough resources to cope with current and future challenges and to recover from them quickly.

Your measurement indicates a medium tension index and a good recovery ability. This healthy tension and the adequate recovery ability show that you have sufficient resources to cope with current and future challenges and to recover from them quickly.

Your measurement indicates a medium tension index and a poor recovery ability. The low recovery ability shows that your resources are exhausted and your body is overwhelmed with the current challenges. It is important for your health that you take some time out to recharge your batteries.

Your measurement indicates a medium tension index and a satisfactory recovery ability. Your health is not negatively affected by the current tension. However, your body might soon run out of energy reserves to cope with increased stress.Take some time out to relax in order to restore your full reserves and get ready for the next challenge.

Your measurement indicates a medium tension index and an excellent recovery ability. This healthy tension and great recovery ability show that you have sufficient resources to cope with current and future challenges and to recover from them quickly.
Your measurement indicates a very high tension index and a good recovery ability. Despite the very high tension, you still have enough reserves to cope with challenges and also to recover from them.

Your measurement indicates a very high tension index and a poor recovery ability. This means that your resources are depleted and your body is overwhelmed with the current challenges. It is important for your health that you take some time out to recharge your batteries.

Your measurement indicates a very high tension index and a satisfactory recovery ability. Despite the very high tension, you still have some reserves left to cope with challenges and also to recover from them. As soon as you can, try to take some time out to relax in order to restore your reserves fully and get ready for the next challenge.

Your measurement indicates a very high tension index and an excellent recovery ability. Although you are very tense, your ability to recover is great. This means that you have sufficient resources to cope with current and future challenges and to recover from them quickly.
